record.title: PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUED MINTING AND ISSUANCE OF CERTAIN $1 COINS IN 2008
record.narrative:
PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUED MINTING AND ISSUANCE OF CERTAIN $1 COINS IN 2008 -- (Senate - February 28, 2008)

[Page: S1390]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Banking Committee be discharged from further consideration of H.R. 5478 and the Senate proceed to its consideration.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered. The clerk will report the bill by title.
The bill clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 5478) to provide for the continued minting and issuance of certain $1 coins in 2008.
record.narrative: There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read a third time and passed, the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, with no intervening action or debate; and that any statements relating to this matter be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (H.R. 5478) was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.
